overview: Michael Schrader is the CEO and co-founder of Vaxess Technologies, a company revolutionizing global health by creating heat-stable vaccines. Vaxess strives to not only lower the cost of vaccine distribution, but also increase access to life-saving products for people around the world. The company was the winner of the 2012 Harvard Business Plan Competition and The 2012 Harvard President’s Challenge for Social Entrepreneurship. Prior to founding Vaxess, Michael worked at Google, Honda, and Toyota. He holds a BSME from Purdue University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
